conclusion: Analyze forces and use conservation of momentum to find static friction on block D.
Four identical wooden blocks on a smooth surface; blocks B and C connected by a spring; force F applied to block B.
System's momentum is conserved as blocks accelerate together.
Force applied to block B is transmitted through the spring, causing all blocks to accelerate together.
Static friction force \(f_s\) on block D balances the force applied to block B.
Static friction force \(f_s\) is equal to the pulling force \(F\).
Mass of block D is \(m\), same as other blocks.
Magnitude of static friction force \(f_s = F\).
